moves.5. Nf3 Nf6 6. h3 h6 7. Bb5 a6 8. Ba4 b5: Bd6 prevents Bf4, which is the Bishop's best square.
moves.11. Ne2 O-O 12. c3 Bb7: Black has caught up in development due to White making a couple of tempo-wasting moves.
moves.13. Nh2 Bxh2+: I felt like I needed to prevent Ng4 and preserve my Nf6 for defensive purposes.
moves.14. Kxh2 Re8 15. Bc2 e5 16. dxe5 Nxe5 17: Nd4 is a good square for this Knight.  It would be good to trade it off.
moves.17... Ne4 18. f4 Nc4 19. b3 Ncd6 20. f5: In haste to attack, I think White missed the hanging pawn.  I calculated and estimated that I would have time to capture it.
moves.20... Nxc3 21. Qg4 Qf6 22. a3 Nde4: Ne4 cuts off protection for the Nd4.
moves.23. Nf3 Ne2 24. Bf4: This is a good square for the Bishop, but it allows the trade.
moves.24... Nxf4 25. Qxf4 Rac8 26. Ne1: I think this was an oversight.  White needed to deal with the threat to Bc2, but I think Rac1 was an improvement.  This move cuts off protection to the Ra1.
moves.26... Qxa1 27. Kg1 Qxa3 28. Bxe4: I think it might have been better to keep the Bishop on the board when down material.
moves.28... Rxe4: I'm not sure this was best.  dxe4 takes valuable squares away from the Ne1.
moves.33. Nf2: This loses instantly.  The Qc7 already cuts off the escape squares for White's King.
